Consider the scalar product of vectors $u$ and $v$, $u\cdot v$. The linear operator $T: \mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$, that determines the vector projection of $\mathbb{R}^2$ on the line $r: y=-2x$ is defined by:

Consider the basis $S=\left\{(1,2),(0,-1)\right\}$ for $\mathbb{R}^2$ and let $T:\mathbb{R}^2 \longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ be the linear operator for which $T(4,2)= (2,-5)  $ and $T(0,-1)=(-3,1)$. Choose the right answer.

Consider the matrix 
$$A_k=\left[\begin{array}{rrr}
 1  & 1  & 0 \\
  -1 & -k  & k-1 \\
  3 & 2  & 2k+1
\end{array}\right]$$
and denote by $L(A_k)$ the space of the rows of the matrix $A_k$. Which of the following statements is true?
answer1: If $k\in \mathbb{R}\backslash \{0, 1\}$ then the dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$
answer2: The dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$ for every $k\in \mathbb{R}$
answer3: If $k\in \mathbb{R}\backslash \{0\}$ then the dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$
answer4: If $k\in \mathbb{R}\backslash \{0, -1\}$ then the dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$

question:
The general solution of the following differential equation
\[
x'+x\cdot\tan( t)=\dfrac{1}{\cos (t)},
\] where $x=x(t)$ is the unknown function, and $t\in\left(  0,\dfrac{\pi}{2}\right)  ,$ is:
A cartesian equation of the line which is perpendicular to the line $r: \dfrac{x}{3}+\dfrac{y}{2}=1$ and contains the point $A=(2, 5)$ is:

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & - & y & + & 2z & - & 3t & = & 1 \\ 
2x & + & y & - & 2z & - & t & = & 2 \\ 
x &- &3y &+ &z &- &2t &= &-1 \\
  &   &      &     &z &- &t &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(5,\,1,\,3,\,3\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(5+20y,\,y,\,-10-13y,\,8+15y\right)$ as solution for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has $\left(5,0,-10,8\right)$ as its unique solution.

&x &+ &y &+ &z &= &0 \\
&-x &+ &3y &+ &2z &= &-1 \\

& W_1 & W_2 & W_3 & W_4\\

How many solutions does the following linear system have?
$$\begin{cases}
x & - & y & + & z & - & 2t & = & 0 \\
-x & - & 5y & + & z & - & 8t & = & 0 \\
2x & + & y & + & z & + & t & = & 0 \\
2x & - & 5y & + & 3z & - & 9t & = & 0
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has infinitely many solutions depending on two parameters.
answer2: The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter.
answer4: The system has a unique solution.

The authorities of the city want to predict the price $y$ of a house, depending on its environment. The environment value $x$ is estimated by a special complex index. In this situation, identify the correct interpretation of the coefficients in the fitted regression line $\hat{y} = 200000+30000x$.
answer1: The slope is equal to $30 000$ and implies that for every unit increase in the environment index the mean value of the house price is estimated to increase by $30 000$ units.
answer2: The slope of $30 000$ implies that for every unit increase in house price, the mean value of the environment index is estimated to increase by $30 000$ units.
answer3: The y-intercept implies that the estimated mean price of a house is equal to $30 000$ units when the index of the environment is equal to $0$ units.
